event.title: 1816, the initial settlement of Bathurst was established

data.event: In 1816, the initial settlement of Bathurst was established on the eastern banks of the Macquarie River, in current-day Kelso.
It was built in 1835 to serve the Anglican parish of Kelso.
Opening in 1976 and formally known as Kelso High School, the Kelso High Campus makes up the Denison College of Secondary Education along with Bathurst High Campus.
It opened on 4 February 1875 and was closed on 6 April 1975.
It opened on 4 February 1875 and was closed on 6 April 1975.
It is now served by coach services.
